Posted By: DoragonShinzui (10/31/2012 7:26:27 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I'll use this space to agree, people going "ZOMG HOT MAGIC CARD" is kind of gross. Have you ever seen a real person talk about how sexy a magic card is? Its kind of... well... sad.  
  
That aside, Glissa is a \*fantastic\* Commander. The casting cost can bite you sometimes, but she's the perfect colors to run a lot of Scars artifacts. Repeatable combo with Mindslaver, repeatable combo with Wayfarer's Twig, Wanderer's Bauble, and Traveler's Amulet(Or as I call them, the Tourist's Trio) makes it so missing a land-drop in her deck is a rare occurance.  
  
Granted, if I had cards like Wurm-Coil, I might get more use out of her, or the Colossi, but even without spending the money, still a fantastic commander.
posts.html:

That aside, Glissa is a *fantastic* Commander. The casting cost can bite you sometimes, but she's the perfect colors to run a lot of Scars artifacts. Repeatable combo with Mindslaver, repeatable combo with Wayfarer's Twig, Wanderer's Bauble, and Traveler's Amulet(Or as I call them, the Tourist's Trio) makes it so missing a land-drop in her deck is a rare occurance.

Granted, if I had cards like Wurm-Coil, I might get more use out of her, or the Colossi, but even without spending the money, still a fantastic commander.

posts.post_content:
When I saw this card, the card [Moonglove Extract](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Moonglove Extract) actually found a home. I'm surprised that no one else seems to have thought of that. The closest I see is [Blazing Torch](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blazing Torch), and Extract is far simpler to use.  
  
My musings aside, I'm glad to see that my favorite critter in Mirrodin getting a facelift. I'm a bit disappointed by how most of HER story isn't actually written as an actual story, but whatever.  
  
This new version is so much better than the original, though. I likey!

Posted By: DrunkManSquakin (9/16/2012 2:03:56 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Now don't get the wrong impression here; she's a strong card, and I really like her, but first strike on her doesn't really make sense. It's not the first time we've seen first strike and deathtouch on the same card, but it is the first time we've seen them together as static abilities, and first strike fits nowhere in her colors.   
  
The deathtouch I can understand, but not first strike. A few cards in black and green with it doesn't mean it fits into the entire color; first strike is ![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol) territory.  
  
It's a crying shame the first "First strike, deathtouch" card wasn't ![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol) because that would have actually made more sense from a flavor perspective, and I'm sure there are plenty of Rakdos players out there tired of getting shafted that would appreciate the gesture as well.
posts.html:
Now don't get the wrong impression here; she's a strong card, and I really like her, but first strike on her doesn't really make sense. It's not the first time we've seen first strike and deathtouch on the same card, but it is the first time we've seen them together as static abilities, and first strike fits nowhere in her colors.

The deathtouch I can understand, but not first strike. A few cards in black and green with it doesn't mean it fits into the entire color; first strike is territory.

It's a crying shame the first "First strike, deathtouch" card wasn't because that would have actually made more sense from a flavor perspective, and I'm sure there are plenty of Rakdos players out there tired of getting shafted that would appreciate the gesture as well.
